intro: Hibbertia scabrifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and serrated, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and small, glandular leaves. Hibbertia scabrifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
